metadata.feature_description: Import and export wiki articles for backup or migration

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Access Import/Export Content feature from Module Actions

steps.action: Navigate to Wiki module page and enter edit mode
steps.expected: Wiki module displayed with Module Actions menu accessible
steps.actual: Wiki module displayed correctly with multiple Wiki modules (432, 433) visible in edit mode

steps.action: Click on Actions button for Wiki module 432 and expand Admin submenu
steps.expected: Module Actions menu should contain Import/Export Content option
steps.actual: Admin menu shows: Settings, Help, Print, Develop, Delete, Refresh. NO Import/Export Content option exists.

steps.action: Click on Edit submenu for Wiki module 433
steps.expected: Edit menu should contain Import/Export Content option
steps.actual: Edit menu shows only one option: 'Add Companion Modules...'. NO Import/Export Content option exists.

issues: Import/Export Content feature does not exist in the Wiki module UI
The feature described in test requirements (Module Actions > Import/Export Content) is not present in any module action menu
Code review confirms: ContentExchangeController.cs is for inter-module content transfer between Evoq Social modules, NOT file-based import/export
Wiki module does not implement IPortable interface (standard DNN import/export mechanism)

observations: Code review of ContentExchangeController.cs reveals it handles 'Content Exchange' between Evoq Social modules (e.g., moving content from Discussions to Wiki), which is different from traditional file-based import/export for backup/migration purposes.
The ContentExchangeController implements IContentExchangeController interface with methods like CreateDestinationItem() and CreateDestinationComment() for inter-module content transfer.
BusinessController.cs implements ModuleSearchBase and IUpgradeable for module upgrades, search indexing, and notifications - NOT import/export functionality.
Dispatch.ascx.cs only defines one ModuleAction: 'AddCompanionModules' (localized key). No Import/Export action is defined.
The Wiki module does NOT implement the IPortable interface, which is the standard DNN mechanism for module-level import/export functionality.
All Module Action menus were checked (Admin: Settings/Help/Print/Develop/Delete/Refresh; Edit: Add Companion Modules; Move: Move options) - none contain Import/Export Content.
The feature 'Import/Export Content' as described in test requirements appears to not be implemented in the Wiki module despite being listed as a feature.
